Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
In an increasingly globalised world, it is important for young people to be able to expand their education and training through mobility. The labour market increasingly requires mobile, flexible people with international experience. Despite the economic crisis, it is estimated that the European labour market will see steady growth over the next 10 years. That is why the EU has implemented the Europe 2020 strategy, which aims to focus greater attention on vocational education and training.
 More and more effort must be made to break down barriers, increase transparency and make for ease of comparison within and between education systems. The education sector should pay closer attention to labour market needs, call for a method of assessing the results of learning and improve the quality of its own standards so as to become more professional. Lastly, creativity, innovation and entrepreneurship should be encouraged, so that Europe’s young people and workers can broaden their knowledge and thus adapt to the needs of the economy. In order to achieve these objectives and to ensure that vocational education and training continue to be a key political priority for everyone in the long term, I voted in favour of the proposal in question.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Madam President, I represent a country that invented the sugar cube. High-quality sugar was something we used to be proud of but the European Union ruthlessly took this pride away from us.
 If Regulation (EC) No 320/2006 is implemented, the Czech Republic will be penalised for its appropriate behaviour towards foreign investors from the original EU countries that it has allowed to take over the sugar industry in the country. This Regulation is an inappropriate attempt to satisfy the interests of the big European sugar refining companies, while the interests of the countries that are the traditional growers and producers are being ignored.
 It is therefore necessary, as the amendment by Mr Fajmon and others suggests, to enable Member States to scrap provisions a) and b) and leave it to the individual Member States to determine how to deal with the critical situation that would arise if the quota fell by 20% or more. Otherwise, the Czech Republic might, absurdly, become an importer of the traditional product it has been making for centuries.
 One day, when our grandchildren are making a list of reasons why the Czech Republic should leave the European Union, the sugar policy and the regulations we are now debating will be at the top of the list.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mrs. President, this is a photo of the milk at 20 cents on the shelf of a supermarket in Asturias this week.Because it seems that either we bring you objective evidence of what is happening so that they fall directly their shame face or you will continue to get palmaditas on your back and look the other way.
Do you know how much it costs to produce the milk to a Spanish farmer?37 cents.This, in addition to being an absolute shame, is called dumping and is illegal.In Spain we produce 25 % less than we consume.However, our farms and our industries are forced to close.An example: this week we were gathered and gathered with workers of the Lactalis plant in Valladolid.More than 80 workers who are going to stay in the street, who will be fired and more than 110 farms that will have to close.In our country, about 65 dairy production farms per month.If this is the situation now, what will happen when the Atci monster is approved?
Ladies, if this is the Europe that you want to build, a socially and territorially unbalanced Europe, we will not allow it.This is a scam, and I remind you that in this Parliament we are, above all, to serve our people.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
I voted against Parliament's resolution on the proposal of directive on electronic databases that are part of the surveillance networks in the Member States.Food safety is one of the main concerns of European citizens and this was seen last year, in the case of frauds on horse meat.Technology is available and that is why Member States must increase its efficiency on identification and traceability methods.The more citizens receive more information on the foods they consume, the greater their confidence, as consumers.
The S&D group supports the need for a mandatory system for electronic animal identification, in a 10-year transition period.In this way, the Member States will have the time to introduce this system, which will allow you to reduce administrative costs, simplify records and guarantee animals traceability.Also, the S&D group supports the preservation of the voluntary labeling system, which works well and which provides manufacturers additional tools to promote their products, and customers the necessary information.
We regret that the agreement to which it was reached did not consider the point of view of the S&D group.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Education is a fundamental right of all people and is also extremely important for gender equality and girls empowerment.Education and training of girls and women is an important European value and is an essential part of the full enjoyment of all social, economic, cultural and political rights.A study conducted by the CEO of the EP for Internal Policy shows that 30 million girls are excluded from the educational system in the world when they should attend elementary school.
The report encourages Member States to implement educational measures measuring the fight against gender stereotypes, learning equality, human dignity and self -esteem of girls and boys so that they can embark on their important decisions autonomously and sufficiently informed, at the teaching of women's awareness of control over theirto the body and to the conflict with homophobic and transphobic bullying and assistance in the fight against discrimination based on sexual orientation and identity.
The report proposes measures to ensure the promotion of gender equality, the increase of professional profiles and competences of girls, and last but not least, improving their personal and professional development in all national educational systems, so I supported the EU girls by education.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Education is a fundamental right of all people and is also extremely important for gender equality and girls empowerment.Education and training of girls and women is an important European value and is an essential part of the full enjoyment of all social, economic, cultural and political rights.A study conducted by the CEO of the EP for Internal Policy shows that 30 million girls are excluded from the educational system in the world when they should attend elementary school.
The report encourages Member States to implement educational measures measuring the fight against gender stereotypes, learning equality, human dignity and self -esteem of girls and boys so that they can embark on their important decisions autonomously and sufficiently informed, at the teaching of women's awareness of control over theirto the body and to the conflict with homophobic and transphobic bullying and assistance in the fight against discrimination based on sexual orientation and identity.
The report proposes measures to ensure the promotion of gender equality, the increase of professional profiles and competences of girls, and last but not least, improving their personal and professional development in all national educational systems, so I supported the EU girls by education.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr President, there are three points in the report on the common organisation of the market in milk which I strongly support. One: private storage of cream and skimmed milk powder should not be abolished, but retained as a safety net in the volatile world of milk production. Two: the school milk scheme is of critical importance, not least in the fight against obesity, and it should be widened to include new and healthy dairy products. Three: a milk fund restructuring programme should be set up for the purpose of retaining for the milk sector savings resulting from the implementation of the mini-milk package, with such a fund being used for marketing support and nutrition awareness.
 Though, at present, the outlook on milk is more optimistic, we need to be sure that no steps are taken that would remove the current safety nets or fail to expand the vision for milk. Nor should savings made be lost to the industry and its promotion.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr President, Mr Duisenberg, ladies and gentlemen, this debate is taking place at a difficult moment as regards economic policy. Growth is declining and inflation is on the increase. The Federal Republic of Germany, which accounts for a third of the euro area, is bringing up the rear in terms of growth, inflation and net government borrowing. It is no longer the locomotive it once was, it is now the last coach in the train.
 At this difficult time it is, above all, important for the European Central Bank, which is a young central bank, to gain credibility. For this reason we too will not be voting for three of the proposals made by the rapporteur in her report.
 The first proposal was that core inflation should be the key factor in economic decision making, that is to say inflation excluding energy and food. This would amount to looking at the world through rose-tinted spectacles, because what matters to the public is not core inflation but inflation including energy and food prices.
 The second proposal that we will be rejecting is that of setting inflation targets. I am convinced that the European Central Bank was right to establish its own definition of stability shortly after it was set up, according to which monetary stability is an inflation rate of less than 2%. That cannot be altered now. If anything, it is precisely in the current difficult situation that the European Central Bank should be measured by its own yardstick. That is the reason why we cannot vote for this second proposal.
 The third proposal relates to the accession countries. The proposal that the accession countries should not in fact be required to meet the inflation criteria of the Maastricht Treaty in the same way, which would also mean a weakening of stability, is something else my Group will not agree to.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng: I voted in favour of the financial supervision package, for the reasons outlined below. The creation of the three authorities must be accompanied by a single set of rules so as to ensure consistent harmonisation and uniform application; this will help the internal market to function more effectively. The authorities must ensure a high, effective and consistent level of regulation and supervision, taking into account the interests of all the Member States and the diverse nature of financial institutions. Matters subject to technical standards should be genuinely technical, and their development requires the expertise of supervisory experts. The technical standards adopted as delegated acts should further develop, specify and determine the conditions for consistent harmonisation and uniform application of the rules included in the basic instruments adopted by the European Parliament and the Council, supplementing or amending certain non-essential elements of the legislative act. This directive should identify situations where a procedural or a substantive issue of compliance with Union law may need to be resolved and the supervisors may not be able to resolve the matter on their own. In such a situation, one of the supervisors involved should be able to refer the issue to the competent European supervisory authority.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr President, I would like to congratulate Mr Duisenberg on a successful year in running euro monetary policy. Clearly what matters is internal price stability, and the external value of the euro is of much less significance. Indeed that was one of the reasons for creating the euro in the first place: it was precisely to protect the European economy from the volatility of the foreign exchanges to which Mr Goebbels has just referred.
 I am particularly pleased, too, that Mr Duisenberg has reiterated his promise to publish forecasts and econometric models, and I entirely understand his caveats. I hope that when he publishes the macroeconometric model he will do so in a form which makes it available and easily usable by outside researchers, perhaps on CD-ROM.
 However, in connection with Parliament's view of last year I would urge Mr Duisenberg to reconsider a formal framework for the publication of summary minutes. As he said, much of the debate which happens within the Council is filtering out in the form of discussion within the monthly bulletin, but this is not the same as a regular report with a formal framework in which it is discussed. That would help anchor expectations within the market, as well as fulfilling the important accountability mandate of the ECB.
 It is also clearly crucial the ECB should look only at the euro zone as a whole in terms of its inflation and price stability objective. It is essential to point out that different growth trends exist within the different national components of the euro zone economy, and that this implies different sustainable wage growth rates over time. That is why it is important that there should be an overall discussion of what potential sustainable growth rates of wages are in each of the component parts of the euro zone economy, and why this will actually help deliver low inflation combined with low unemployment.
 Those are the main points I would like to make. I would also very much like to back Mr Goebbels' remarks about the importance of enlargement, namely that we should not have two standards – one for us and one for them. I very much hope that we will continue to apply the criteria of the Treaty, no more and no less.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng: I voted "restrained" on the report of my Wosenberg colleague on the professional career career of women in science and higher education and the presence of the so -called.Glass ceilings.The term "glass ceiling", introduced in 1986 by journalists, describes the invisible barriers that limit women's progress to higher positions within their professional development.For me and for my group of ambiguous messages, they are sent through paragraph 48 of the report, which relates to the gender balance in the board of directors and specific goals and quotas.I do not support gender discrimination and I think my colleague has developed an excellent report, but I do not think that the introduction of quotas is a decision.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
I voted for the report on the electronic identification of bovine animals and deleting the provisions on voluntary beef labelling. The electronic identification of bovine animals makes it possible to obtain more reliable data, while also strengthening the traceability system and food safety.
 Current legislation needs to be adapted, particularly in order to recognise electronic identification as an official method of identifying bovine animals. The tracing of beef to source via identification and registration is a prerequisite for origin labelling throughout the food chain. These measures safeguard consumer protection and public health, and promote consumer confidence. Using electronic identification systems could streamline traceability processes through automated and more accurate reading and recording in the holding register. Furthermore, it would enable animal movements to be registered automatically in the online database, thereby improving the system’s speed, reliability and accuracy. Using electronic identification systems would improve the management of direct payments to farmers granted per animal, through applying better controls and reducing the risks of payment errors.
Answer.manifesto_class.labels: ["Government and administrative efficiency","Market regulation","Middle Class & Professional Groups"]

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng: Thank you, Mr President. Our draft resolution on the G20 summit says that, firstly, various European Union countries have received support from the International Monetary Fund to resolve balance of payments problems and, secondly, that various countries in the euro zone have, thanks directly to the euro, been able to avoid exchange rate pressure in this situation. Unfortunately, however, the new European Union Member States cannot reduce this currency risk pressure, because they cannot join the euro zone. At the same time, the economy has become overheated in several new EU states as a direct result of the injection of a very large amount of money by many European banks, fighting to carve out a market in these states. Now it is borrowers who have been left to bear all the currency risk. I would therefore appeal for us to consider, particularly in the new EU Member States that have joined the exchange rate mechanism tool and keep to a fixed exchange rate that allows a large part of these loans to be paid back to European banks, whether this should not mean that these countries should also be helped with a swifter introduction of the euro. This is particularly crucial because solidarity is extremely important in difficult times. In reality, we are all in the same boat – especially now, when, to be honest, even those countries that have already joined the euro cannot satisfy the Maastricht criteria, with budget deficits of over 10%. Since we are in the same boat, let us think in the same way! Thank you.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Madam President, European citizens are well aware that the troika and the memorandum were not a one -way street, as the report unfortunately finds, but they have been the best alibi to impose harsh austerity measures and to redistribute wealth at the expense of the poor and medium -sized strata..The Greeks, dear colleagues, the Portuguese, the Irish, the Cypriots, unfortunately know very well that human lives have been sacrificed to save their financial sector, their banks and their profits.Young people, in all countries of Europe, know that as a result of these policies they do not have the right to work, they do not have the right to dream, remain in the vestibule of life.
The only ones who decide whether these policies were necessary are the peoples of Europe.By voting in May, they will condemn the forces that today, through the report, legitimize the troika and justify policies, condemn those forces that have incorporated the Memorandum and Trojan policies into European law and vote for their right to right.In education, health, work, for a Europe of solidarity and democracy.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng: Mr President, Mr Bushill-Matthews’ report is on financial assistance for small and medium-sized enterprises. A Genoese 70-year old pensioner, Mr Guido Facchinetti, who is an expert cook and has worked in restaurants all his life, asked me to vote for this document for the reasons I have already given, namely that it is appropriate for small and medium-sized enterprises to be financed by Europe. He said to me: “If I had the financial where-with-all, despite the fact I am 70 years old, I would open new restaurants throughout Europe serving trenette with pesto, Genoa-style chick pea flour, Recco focaccia and Camogli pan-fried fish” – apologies to any of my fish-loving friends who are listening – “for these are excellent dishes and I would like to take them to the whole of Europe. All I need is the money!” I hope that this document will make it possible for him to continue to exercise his outstanding abilities as an Italian and a Genoese cook.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr President, under Rule 152 of the Rules of Procedure, I urge Parliament to close the debate on Oral Question O—000141/2015 on a new animal welfare strategy for 2016–2020 with a resolution.
 The current animal welfare strategy ends on 31 December and the Commission shows no sign of coming forward with a new strategy. This is unacceptable. There are many issues concerning animal welfare in the European Union which should be addressed, and we want the Commission to come forward with a clear roadmap to do that.
 Also, on behalf of my colleague, Stefan Eck, I ask for your support to add this resolution to close the debate. If you think animals matter, this is the time to show it.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Farmers farm because they like farming, and above all they love animals and they go to great efforts to protect them, getting up in the middle of the night to oversee cows calving, sheep lambing, paying big veterinary bills to ensure they’re as healthy as possible. And for that reason we shouldn’t be putting limits on what they can do, particularly when they have to trade, which means the animals have to leave the farm.
 So putting time limits, arbitrary time limits, especially for countries like Portugal and Ireland, makes absolutely no sense. By all means transport them to the highest possible standards, but do not limit the opportunity to trade, because freedom of movement is an essential pillar of the European Union.
 Having said that, there are a lot of abuses in industrial units, particularly in caged birds, etc., and I do agree we need to move quickly to end the cage age.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
I voted in favor of the resolution of the European Parliament on the strengthening of consumer rights in the digital single market because this text, even if it is not perfect, resumes several of my concerns.In particular, we highlight with satisfaction the growth of electronic commerce, call to create a legislative environment which encourages creativity and innovation, while worrying about making the digital divide disappear, or eliminating the existing obstacles that continue to curbThe complete deployment of the digital single market.
Then, we clearly attack the need to guarantee equitable game rules in the research and online advertising sectors.In this regard, the Commission must act firmly within the framework of its surveys on potential abuse of dominant position.In addition, we must aim for the improvement of the long -term situation, and several options are possible.The decoupling of activities as a search engines for other commercial services can be one of the tracks to explore.It is in any case time to take firm options.Improving the situation will benefit consumers, Internet users, potentially injured online companies, growth.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
I would like to inform the House that an official delegation from the National Institute for Public and Social Administration in the People’s Republic of China, under the direction of Mr Wang Zhongyn, Member of the Council of State and Secretary General of the Council of State Affairs, is now seated in the official stand. This delegation is visiting France as part of an exchange programme between the National Institute for Public Administration and the Ecole Nationale d’Administration in Paris.
 I would like to offer you all a warm welcome and hope your visit to our Parliament proves fruitful.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
This text comes in preparation for the December WTO meeting in Nairobi.
The European Parliament requests that the WTO sets up a free world exchange which dismantles the standards of each country for the benefit of global standards.This text proposes that the WTO can seize "non -commercial subjects".Such abandonments of sovereignty would be catastrophic since they would deprive states of being able to legislate.
This text also requires that the WTO agreements be legally binding for the signatory states.
I voted against.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
What I must tell you is that I believe that the Council and the European institutions are doing a good job. I believe that they have done a good job and that a vast contribution has been made to preventing a collapse in the availability of liquidity throughout the economy.
 Ecofin has been following and continues to follow the measures which have been adopted by the Member States. It is doing this is a systematic manner. For example, Ecofin is currently tasked with observing how guarantees granted to banks are made available, whether or not there are restrictions set for companies in the financial sector and how credit finance is being carried out by the European Central Bank.
 I would simply like to say that on 7 December 2009, Mr Trichet, the President of the European Central Bank himself said that there are no restrictions to supply for banks to borrow money from the European Central Bank. There are no restrictions to supply. If there are banks which do not make use of this, that is a matter for each of these financial bodies; however, there are no forms of restriction as far as the European Union or the European Central Bank are concerned.
 In any case, the Council, together with the European Parliament, is, of course, more than happy to examine the present directives to be debated in relation to financial supervision systems or any other initiative which the Commission may put forward in this regard.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
The objectives in the seventh framework programme remain exactly the same as the objectives in the previous programme, although the tools have been slightly modified.
 The work programmes will encourage women’s participation in research and highlight the relevance of gender in specific topics. Large projects will have the possibility and will be encouraged to include gender equality actions in their projects, and these will be reimbursable actions, just like other activities in the projects.
 However, I would like to repeat that we should and we will give a positive example, but we are all aware that we cannot solve the problem without looking beyond the research portfolio. We are now facing difficulties that are part of a broader picture of reality in a society resulting in this unfavourable and unfair situation in which we are not using all of our knowledge potential. That is why I believe that the debate we will be having and which will specifically focus also on this issue is so crucially important.
 Concerning how we are trying to be practical, I can give you an example of how we address the question of evaluation panels, in which we have a target for 40% participation by women. Article 17 of the rules of participation in the seventh framework programme specifies that in the selection of independent experts, we should ensure reasonable gender balance. Women’s participation in evaluation panels has increased since the Commission set that target in 1999. It went up from 22% in 1999 to 30% in 2005. Unfortunately, I still do not have the figure for 2006.
 If we compare this with the proportion of women in our expert database, which is only 25%, that will give you a clear sign that we are trying to do our best. On top of that, the Commission encourages female experts to register on our database. The European platform of women scientists created at the end of 2005 will help us in this respect. Those are the things we intend to do.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng: We have voted in favor of the amendment to section 46 Resolution of the European Parliament, of October 22, 2014, on the position of the Council on the Rectifying Budget Project No. 2/2014 of the European Union for the year 2014, Section III, asWe consider that credits of the PAC should not be used not any other budget credits to finance bullfighting activities that involve the death of the bull.Financing of this type, in addition, constitutes a violation of the European Agreement for the Protection of Animals in livestock farms (Directive 98/58/EC of the Council).

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr President, I speak on behalf of our shadow rapporteur, Eider Gardiazábal, who is on the way to Strasbourg right now.
 Of course, we cannot be happy with the size of the budget, and I think we are going to have this conversation over the next seven years given the financial framework that we have agreed. But I think that, within this constraint, the positive fact is that Parliament was able to restore commitment levels to the level proposed in the draft budget by the Commission, and we did not allow a decrease. We have a slight increase in some important areas such as the digital agenda, the social dialogue, micro-finance and issues that help the recovery of the economy, as well as humanitarian aid and the Palestine allocations, which are important to us.
 The big problem, though, in next year’s budget is in the level of payments. Despite the fact that we have succeeded in increasing by EUR 500 million the initial Council position, we all know that the payments are not going to be enough next year. So when we insist on reflecting this, using the flexibility instrument or the contingency margin, we are absolutely sure that next year we will have to have recourse to it.
 As the Presidency mentioned, we are going to stick very much to the declaration which has been adopted by the two institutions. The European Union has to pay all the bills that are put on the table. That means that next year the Council has to be ready to have recourse to all the instruments of the MFF, including the contingency and the flexibility instruments, if such need arises, and this is going to be very important for Parliament.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng: Mr Chairman, the purpose of this directive is to contribute to the proper operation of the internal market by coordinating the laws and other legal acts of Member States, and the removal of obstacles to free movement of goods and services.This will improve supply in the EU market.That is why it is so important to eliminate obstacles due to different rules.According to the directive, the burden of small and medium -sized enterprises must be reduced.Nevertheless, it is important to leave these entities according to your application.Innovations are absolutely important in achieving the aims of the Directive, so maintaining the right innovative companies is so important.Functionality, not the technical specifications of the product, must be based on market access requirements.The digital market is also important.The aim of the digital common market strategy is to achieve more durable economic and social benefits in facilitating trade and increasing employment in the Union.EU consumers are still unable to fully use lower prices and a higher choice that can ensure the common market.There is also a need to take common steps to ensure comprehensive access to new electronic content to people with disabilities.It is therefore necessary to reconcile access to the requirements of the entire digital market and ensure that all union citizens, regardless of their effectiveness, can take advantage of it.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng: Mr Chairman, the purpose of this directive is to contribute to the proper operation of the internal market by coordinating the laws and other legal acts of Member States, and the removal of obstacles to free movement of goods and services.This will improve supply in the EU market.That is why it is so important to eliminate obstacles due to different rules.According to the directive, the burden of small and medium -sized enterprises must be reduced.Nevertheless, it is important to leave these entities according to your application.Innovations are absolutely important in achieving the aims of the Directive, so maintaining the right innovative companies is so important.Functionality, not the technical specifications of the product, must be based on market access requirements.The digital market is also important.The aim of the digital common market strategy is to achieve more durable economic and social benefits in facilitating trade and increasing employment in the Union.EU consumers are still unable to fully use lower prices and a higher choice that can ensure the common market.There is also a need to take common steps to ensure comprehensive access to new electronic content to people with disabilities.It is therefore necessary to reconcile access to the requirements of the entire digital market and ensure that all union citizens, regardless of their effectiveness, can take advantage of it.

Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng: The coordination of the economic policy is a necessary step for achieving the objectives dedicated by the Treaty on the functioning of the European Union.Coordination is essential, especially in the field of fiscal policy, budget policy and employment policy.One of the procedures applied in this regard is the open method of coordination, which allows the identification of the optimal practices applied in a Member State and their application in other Member States.It is necessary to develop means to ensure that the elements of sustainable fiscal discipline are accompanied by concrete proposals regarding the economic growth and the creation of jobs.I find it appropriate to encourage private investments that generate growth elements.
Answer.manifesto_class.labels: ["Government and administrative efficiency","Market regulation","Incentives","Labor Groups Positive","Economic Growth"]

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr President, I will be emphatically voting against this report tomorrow, because the Erasmus Mundus programme, in its current form, is totally unacceptable to me. It is unacceptable because the scale at which it gives undue preference to students from outside the EU compared to European students is too great.
 The numbers, after all, speak for themselves. Since the beginning of the programme in 2004, some 4 150 students from outside the Union have taken part. The grant for a one-year course is EUR 21 000, and EUR 42 000 for two years. This means that the total cost of students from outside the Union taking part is no less than EUR 161 850 000.
 The 200 or so EU students who took part in the programme received, on average, a grant of only EUR 3 100 to study outside of Europe. This translates into a total cost of only EUR 620 000.
 Well, discrimination of this kind is unacceptable to me and extending this programme is therefore altogether wrong.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mrs. President, 47 % of current jobs will probably disappear in the next 25 years, and 85 % of those of 2030 jobs are not yet invented.Those are data - they can move in some percentages, but that is a reality.
The digital economy offers opportunities, but it offers serious risks that we already live, including the digital gap, a gap that is old, which is geographical, which is gender, which is social.And, given this growth of inequality, what can we do?More social Europe, that is, more education, more training, more protection.
That means we have to make a holistic approach to the problem.We have approached with the Green Pact to a will to transform our economic model.How are we bet on a social deal, for a new social contract that is able to combine these changes and avoid collateral damage to people, millions of European citizens who will not be able, without help and without concrete measures, to accept that transition, to that change, and can be left behind.That risk is a certain risk.We have to do our can not happen.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr. President, this report is extremely important because it gives a clear message that the Youth Guarantee Program is a cost -effective program.Of course, we also ask all of us to increase his efficiency, that as many young people as possible be truly employed and that it is his main result.
However, proof that he is worthwhile is 14 million young people who have undergone new forms of education, additional forms of education, two million young people who have managed to get a job thanks to the activities from this program.One should always strive for a better and better result.So, of course, we still need to strengthen small and medium -sized entrepreneurs, and to encourage young people to self -employment and education that will allow them to get to work immediately, not to educate themselves only when they finish school and start working.
Answer.manifesto_class.labels: ["Government and administrative efficiency","Market regulation","Incentives","Labor Groups Positive"]

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
This report is pronounced on the recommendation of August 24, 2006 of the European Commission, in which it appeals to the Member States to coordinate their efforts to create European level synergies, proposing the creation of aEuropean digital library, in the form of a multilingual common access point to European cultural heritage.On November 13, 2006, the Council unanimously pronounced in favor of these recommendations.
The European Parliament has spoken favorably but makes a set of proposals that want to be clarifying, taking into account the set of problems that may arise, including in the work of conceptual and technical organization of all categories of cultural material, in the phases that is necessarytake into account and the potential offered by the free written material of rights.
Although we have doubts about several proposals included in the resolution of the European Parliament, we faced the idea, however, warning of the need to defend copyright, to the defense of linguistic and cultural diversity, for the solidarity and cohesion and economic cohesion andsocially, in order to ensure that an interesting idea is not transformed into one more reason for discrimination and social exclusion.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Madam President, President Obama’s proposal for an American Jobs Act contains many elements and policy initiatives which sorely lack a European equivalent. However, conservative forces in the US Senate blocked their approval for two days in a stance paralleled in Europe by the austerity six-pack; our only approach to the severe economic crisis we find ourselves in. The ‘Buy American’ provisions enshrined in the American Jobs Act which emulates Obama’s approach in the 2009 American Recovery and Reinvestment Act is understandable in the face of US unemployment figures, but protectionism is not the way out of the economic woes afflicting both sides of the Atlantic.
 Through work in the Committee on the Internal Market and the EP Delegation to the US, I have emphasised the untapped benefits of further transatlantic market integration. There is much work to be done to improve network interoperability and to facilitate SMEs’ access to the transatlantic markets.
 Upstream regulatory support and cooperation between the US and the EU is still insipid and could prevent unintended trade barriers. We are far more likely to spur growth and job creation if we work together rather than retrenching a sad repetition of post-Great Depression protectionism.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
I would like to reiterate what I said earlier. Mr Ryan is right. It is true that one of the problems for public opinion in Europe is, on the one hand, that the volume of development aid remains high. In this respect, as you know, the European Union is the biggest donor of development aid. On the other hand, it is essential that the mechanisms of good governance and effective control are in place. There must also be better information for the public about aid and the appropriation of aid by beneficiary countries and, to be honest, monitoring of governance – a certain conditionality, if you like – must be at the heart of development policy.
 You are all right, corruption is a scourge. I do not know whether Transparency International’s figures are accurate, as you yourself acknowledged, but in any case the point you made was correct. Consequently, there cannot be an increase in development aid except through a reinforcement of control mechanisms, anti-fraud mechanisms, anti-corruption mechanisms, and each time this should be one of the objectives of the agreements.
 This is also what the Council concluded on 27 May in terms of its development policy objectives. There must be better control mechanisms and conditionality to protect financial interests, but more importantly, as you pointed out, Mr Ryan, to combat corruption.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Ms. Commissioner, President!The German State Secretary Machn was publicly annoyed that he had to travel to Africa shortly before Christmas, for the WTO Minister Conference in Nairobi.
It was already clear that only a mouse was born there.This is not the fault of the Europeans and the OECD, rather the Indians and Brazilians broke again.Anyone who travels to Nairobi and really only has the old concepts of free trade wastes time.60 million refugees in the world make it clear what serious effect the mistakes in international trading policy have since founded the WTO.
You must and cannot accuse India that at least this one country finds the nutrition of your own population more important than free trade and speculation with food in the globalized markets.No, Pascal Lamy must definitely be dialed if he demands that the WTO must finally integrate its work into the goal of governments, civil society and international organizations.
The Doha round was to overcome poverty, which had led to recruiting the terrorists from 09/11.The current events remind us that this goal was forgotten too quickly.
In Nairobi, the basic change of course with regard to goals and mechanisms of international trade policy and their rules must be discussed.Not more, but not less!It is about the future of the multilateral partnership of the world trade system, and it's about the perspectives and a yes to Doha.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng: In Europe, women represent only 19% of bosses in the ICT and communications sectors and 9% of developers, which is unacceptable, since the ICT and communications sectors can promote women’s empowerment in all sectors of the economy. Digitalisation has a great impact on the labour market and it is an effective tool for the promotion of gender equality to the younger generations. Thus, I believe that women need further education and training in ICT, in order to take advantage of the full range of benefits that this sector of the economy provides. Furthermore, I stress the need to fight violence and gender stereotypes against women in the digital area and I gave my full support to this resolution.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng: The European Union needs a new policy in terms of security and diversification of energy supply.Investments in the field of energy supported by the cohesion policy also lead to economic growth at local level, but also to the creation of new jobs.In order to have a competitive economy, I think the European Union must invest in the development of renewable energies.Cohesion funds could help numerous regions of Europe in the efficiency of consumption, but also in the construction of energy storage and transport infrastructures.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr President, ten new countries and ten new Commissioners. The ten new countries have to meet the new criteria, and so do the Commissioners. Unfortunately, the outcome of the hearing of one candidate, Mr Borg, was that for the time being, Parliament is not persuaded by his approach to development cooperation.
 It is in public that we consider candidates for office, and in public that we deliver our verdict on them. I should like to make it quite clear that we do this with full respect of the person, but also completely independently. We have to take our work seriously and that is why specific reference is made, in the draft resolution on which we are voting this afternoon, to the critical verdict of the competent parliamentary committee.
 We would like to see a drastic change by October; if not, we ought to look for another candidate for development cooperation and poverty control. I am pronouncing this verdict openly. However, if the Commission would at least indicate that it has taken due notice of the critical verdict in the draft resolution, that would greatly increase the value of our work in the hearings.
 (Applause)

Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr President, ten new countries and ten new Commissioners. The ten new countries have to meet the new criteria, and so do the Commissioners.  It is in public that we consider candidates for office, and in public that we deliver our verdict on them. Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng: I supported this report, considering it as a reasonable compromise and a major step towards direct payments paid to fairer European farmers.By 2020, farmers from different Member States should receive at least 72% of the EU average direct payment payments, which is, given the current large division of direct payments, where, for example, Estonia received only 44% of the EU average, still significant progress.According to the plan proposed by Parliament, Estonia has a 95%increase in the two -period direct payments, in a situation where direct payments from 27 countries in 11 countries have decreased.Of course, the harmonization of direct payments could be faster, but given the current reality, where the path of reducing the tools is moved, we can be satisfied.I also consider it important to implement environmentally friendly agricultural agencies, where 30% of the direct payments of the Member States can only be used with environmentally friendly farming.
Answer.manifesto_class.labels: ["Government and administrative efficiency","Market regulation","Middle Class & Professional Groups","Incentives","Anti-Growth Economy"]

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mrs. President!Article 13 Union law states: The EU must take into account the well -being of the animals as a feelings in full.Animals are not products.Nevertheless, most of them are treated in Europe.On the other hand, Europeans are defending themselves how many successful European citizens' initiatives and a lot of local voluntary action show.
The European Commission has failed compared to millions of citizens who want more protection and well -being of animals by either not presenting the necessary animal welfare laws at all, so that they can only be treated after the election.As a commission, you are driven by the interests of the animal husbandry industry, bent in front of the agricultural industrial lobby and ultimately violate EU law.
Therefore, we are now asking you: do something against the daily animal quality, no longer delay the animal welfare laws, and finally create the position of an animal welfare commissioner on the next commission!It is high time.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng: I voted for the report on organic production and labelling organic products. I think that operators need to comply with the production regulations established at EU level, as well as with the measures and conditions required to implement them. To implement this regulation, the Commission needs to have the authorisation to adopt implementing acts for assigning code numbers under the control scheme, indicating the origin of products and providing uniform rules on the exchange of information to be sent by Member States, third countries, control authorities and control bodies. It is important to publish this information and the information about recognising third countries, control authorities and control bodies for the purposes of equivalence and compliance. I think that the European Union organic production logo can be used for labelling, presenting and advertising products which fulfil the requirements stipulated by this regulation. This regulation must be applied uniformly in the EU, especially the methods and conditions which need to be taken into account for online certification, with the aim of ensuring transparency by exchanging information quickly, efficiently, accurately and cost-effectively.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng: This report provides for the Member States to lodge interest-bearing deposits or pay fines, as part of the preventive and corrective parts of the Stability and Growth Pact. This is a system of punishment in advance, when a system of incentives would be more useful. The thinking behind it slots perfectly into the overall ‘philosophy’ of the package in question. I am voting against for these reasons.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
China is a strategic commercial partner for the European Union, being its second largest commercial partner, generating a business volume that exceeds a thousand million euros per day.
The Chinese state joined the World Trade Organization in 2005, committing to allow all prices to be determined by market conditions, so the EU must ensure that China fulfills this obligation.
However, a state influence on the economy has been verified, distorting the signs that reflect supply and demand.
In this sense, I vote in favor of the joint resolution signed by the PPE political group, as I consider that China must respect the obligations attached to it because it is a member of the WTO.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
I voted in favour of this report as it outlines valid factors which are important in the implementation of social and environmental standards and human rights, and for ensuring corporate responsibility.
 Business and trade should incorporate a gender-mainstreaming approach, as they can play a pivotal role in promoting gender equality. We need greater coherence with respect to development, to really and truly have a sustainable environment. The EU’s trade strategy can also be a tool for the promotion of democratic values in third countries. Trade and human rights reinforce one another and our strategy may also have an important role to play in offering positive incentives in terms of promoting human rights, democracy, environmental standards and corporate responsibility.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr President, the two regulations on the table aim to give the Commission greater powers to scrutinise national budgets and economic policies. The rules will be stricter and failing Member States will have budget cuts and structural reforms forced on them by the Brussels technocrats to redress their financial balance.
 This stronger surveillance is called ‘bailing them out’. Member States will be punished or fined – given a caning, one might say. Financial penalties will be harsher and more automatic. Even though certain amendments are aimed at preventing there being nothing more than budgetary austerity by introducing growth measures, your proposals are only there to sugar the pill.
 You know as well as I do that growth cannot be created to order. We are losing our budgetary sovereignty and our freedom to choose our policies forever, with Parliament’s collusion, although the people have not been consulted. Once the European bureaucratic, technocratic and totalitarian state has gradually – imperceptibly – become fully established, we will have lost our freedom as a people once and for all.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
The report, which I have approved, recalls that the principles of aid efficiency have significantly contributed to the progress made towards the millennium objectives for development in many countries, but that this progress still remains unequal.He also underlines that public development aid can help implement the principle of the democratic appropriation of aid by the countries concerned.
The deputies also invite all development players to implement the commitments of the Paris Declaration.These are based in particular on sufficient funding of the development policy which must be put at the service of the eradication of poverty and the promotion of objectives for sustainable development.But to achieve this, donors must respect their commitments because more than $ 2,000 billion in assistance is missing to provide developing countries in order to achieve the millennial development objectives.
The report also insists on improving the transparency of development aid and the fight against corruption in beneficiary countries which constitutes a serious threat to democratic legitimacy and public support for development aid in donor countries.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
President!First of all, I would like to thank Commissioner Oettinger and his team on the commission for the work they have done.I can really congratulate you.If we look at the result what has come out now, then we are very close to what you, Mr. Oettinger, have suggested with your team.
You can water a little water into the wine, which comes out every year.In this respect, you really have to ask yourself: Is this procedure that we carry out here in the EU for creating the budget?I mean no.I mean no because the MPs in this house should finally make it clear: we don't talk about money that grows on trees or that is thrown with helicopters;This is the money of taxpayers.This is money, that comes from the EU Member States, that has to be generated first.
It bothers me incredible if some speakers pretend that the Member States were the brakers and the EU would be the great organization here, which simply would have to open the box and then we could immediately remove unemployment and promote SMEs in unexpected proportions.
I think that is a completely wrong message;This does not send out the right signals.The EU can do many things much better than fight the individual Member States, for example the migration crisis.But you have to clarify which political goals we pursue.Before we spend money, we first have to make it clear what should be achieved.The same applies to Connecting Europe and many other programs that we have who are justified.But we have to do them more efficiently.As long as we don't do that, we are here on the wrong track.That's why I think we stay under our possibilities with this household - unfortunately God.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng: Madam President, ‘harmonisation’ and ‘European Union’ are words that go hand in hand. It is no surprise, therefore, to see a debate on three legislative reports aiming to increase harmonisation between Member States. The one-size-fits-all approach of EU regulation is far from perfect, and these regulations in discussion are no exception. The UK Government, for example, has highlighted concerns at the Personal Protective Equipment Regulation and announced that it opposes this regulation passing. Yet, as we all know too well, the UK will be forced to accept it. I am sure that we could all agree that prosperous, mutually beneficial and efficient trade between nations is desirable by all. But it is the growing number of harmonised regulations: are they really necessary? I am afraid I am not yet convinced.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr. President, Madam Commissioner, dear colleagues, in recent months, European citizens feel directly and painfully the effects of war through price increases, including basic foods, and feel how our purchasing power is affected due to the blockade of cereals that Russia doesTo Putin.
And if we do not take urgent measures to facilitate Ukraine's stock exports, the impact will be huge, through uncontrolled increases in food prices, by severe impact on the most vulnerable, hunger that can again trigger massive migration to Europe, from the Middle East.and North or Subsaharan Africa.
In order not to happen all these things, I propose to work with the Commission and yes, we have to put pressure on the commission, to ensure a better coordination of what is happening at the border with Ukraine.What we, in the Task-Force we created in the Renew group for food security, we propose that these green corridors actually exist and they will be followed by the commission, but also to simplify the deletion procedures at the borderWith Ukraine, which is very late.
Raw material and help for the producers in Ukraine to continue their activity and, why not, even a financial fund to ensure the purchase of production for next year, which can be distributed for humanitarian aid, because it will be necessaryThat.Unlocking the export of cereals from Ukraine will help both Ukraine's economy and food security issues.Therefore, the responsibility of the European Union is great.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Madam President, in the United Kingdom we have a game show on Radio 4 called  in which contestants have to speak on any subject for 60 seconds without hesitation, deviation or repetition. Sixty seconds is not enough to do justice to a topic there and neither is it here. But the Committee on Budgets discussions show that the 2016 budget will be all about repetition.
 This year, the European Union has learned none of the lessons from last year’s elections. There is no deviation from the previous course of centralising as much money as possible in the hands of Brussels and Strasbourg, disregarding the ability of Member States to spend their money better themselves, and the report envisages more immigration, not less. So I can say without hesitation that this is bad for Britain.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
The report commented on the Commission's annual budgetary recommendations to the EU member states.
He initially welcomes the Commission's focus on structural reforms, investments, fiscal responsibility and the improvement of the conditions on the labor markets.He also realizes that the future of the European economic area is in danger through the fundamental structural weaknesses of the EU and the structural difference between regions.
However, this important analysis contrasts with demands that Alfa cannot support in any way.The report u.an economic and fiscal union, minimum wages or an EU tax.For this reason, I rejected this report.
Incidentally - and this is my Ceterum Censeo - I think that the unit euro needs to be abolished.It leads to confidence and discord in Europe.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr. Chairman!Solidarity is a great European value - such a rule that one for all, all for one.In the name of this solidarity, sanctions for trade with Russia were established, because this is what the safety of Europe requires, because this was required by the firmly opposing Russian expansion and the threat to peace in Europe.The other way, this principle of Solidarity no longer worked or worked very poorly, because farmers suffered the economic consequences of these sanctions.A farmer in Finland, in the Baltic countries or Poland, farmers who could not sell their milk or their apples (in the case of Poland it was a real drama, because a million tons of apples were previously lived for export to Russia and this was suspended), also farmersOther countries, France or Germany, they suffered great losses - these were losses in the amount of the Ukilk of billions of euros, and the help that the farmers received were only hundreds of millions of euros, and this unfairly, not always wisely divided.It is a pity that this fund created every year in the event of a crisis in a fairly significant amount was not used for this purpose.The question arises, why this fund is at all, since it was not used in such a situation as it appeared in connection with the Russian embargo.
I appeal to manage this fund reasonably in the future and use it in such situations.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr President, the foundation of the EU rests on the principle of representative democracy. We as members of the European Parliament have a duty to make sure that Europe’s policies reflect the will of citizens. Therefore I wish to express the wariness caused by the ever-increasing number of GMO authorisations, and when I do this I speak on behalf of the majority of the citizens of the European Union. A Eurobarometer published in March of this year indicates that 58% of Europeans are against GMOs. Over a third of them consider that they are not being properly informed of the benefits and risk of GMO usage in agriculture.
 These figures should worry us. Instead, the Commission continues authorising an ever-increasing number of GMOs to enter the EU agricultural market. The 8 September authorisation of another genetically-modified soya bean is but the latest example.
 Esteemed colleagues, in consideration of these facts I suggest we ask the Commission to start an EU-wide information campaign on the risks and benefits that GMO represent to people and the environment. A new assessment should follow. Until the citizens of Europe are properly informed and express their position on this very sensitive subject, I am asking the Commission to stop authorising any new GMOs.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr President, I would like to thank the Commission for this paper, but it is not before time. Often, the debate on globalisation is polarised. On one side we have the gung-ho supporters of free trade, regardless, and on the other we have the protectionists, for whom no trade deal is ever right. For me, this is the challenge of our generation: to manage globalisation so that free trade is fair trade. As you said, Commissioner, this must ensure that the benefits of trade are distributed fairly among our citizens. But in the last decade this has not happened in the EU. While our economy has grown overall, real incomes of middle-class households have largely stagnated.
 Commissioner, some of the messages to be sent to our citizens are contradictory. We, for example, have extra-judicial courts to enforce investors’ rights but no binding mechanism to enforce environmental standards, health and safety standards and decent work conditions. However, I do welcome this paper and the work done by Commissioner Vestager in trying to ensure that large corporations pay their fair share of tax, a crucial element for fair globalisation. At EU level, investment in universal broadband access allied to lifelong learning will be essential if EU citizens are to benefit from globalisation. Finally, as rapporteur for the Globalisation Fund, I believe it has a role to play in providing a safety net, but it must be adequately resourced and sufficiently flexible so that it is available to workers in the SME sector.
 (The speaker agreed to take a blue-card question under Rule 162(8))

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
In the face of the world pandemic of coronavirus, we need a new common agricultural policy as soon as possible, which will ensure food security and financial support for over 10 million farms in the EU.High -quality and healthy food for 500 million Europeans are efficient, financially stable and innovative agriculture!
That is why direct payments under the European Agricultural Fund are so important.I do not agree that the division of funds between individual EU countries is still unfair and in the farmers of some member states, including Polish countries.The poor pace of leveling of the level of direct payment proposed by the Commission maintains the disproportion of the support of agricultural producers operating on the uniform market.
I agree with the need to increase the environmental and climate ambitions of the CAP.However, I oppose establishing minimal levels of budget expenditure on ecoschematics.In my opinion, a more reasonable and more effective approach is in which Member States can decide how, what means and in what proportions these goals will be achieved.I also believe that the Member States should be guaranteed flexibility in the possibility of using unused funds for ecoschematics in a given year.I believe that we will quickly find an agreement that will be equal and fair to all European farmers.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
President!Mr. Commissioner, thank you very much, I can only support your paper.I like the biggest tenor in this report.One point is very important here, namely the question of further training of those people who drive these spray machines.I just participated in such a course in December, although I still have three or four others on my company who did it.So further training in this question is exceptionally important.
They also addressed the further development of crop protection technology.I can only recommend that as a practical farmer.But I would also like to thank the rapporteur.She wrote a lot of passion in there and jumped out of the grid here and there too.
So we debate here about sustainable pesticide use.We don't talk about GAP here, and we don't talk about the pollution of the groundwater.But if you want to talk to me about the pollution of the groundwater, you are welcome to have it.I tell you: As long as you all - and I also - want to buy cheap meat, you shouldn't be surprised that the facts are very simple.There were 80 pigs on my father's operation, on my 800, and with my neighbor - the next generation - there are 3,000. If you describe it as sustainability, then we are not on a course.
Otherwise, Commissioner: Good luck, and please stay hard with the neonicinoids.We banned them and it stays that way.If we now get 20 exceptions approved by you, then those countries that prohibit the neonicinoids will get lead shoes on their feet, and the other races with sneakers through this competition.I can't accept that.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr President, in an ever more globalised world it is vital the UK does not put all its eggs into one basket. We are disproportionately affected by the eurozone crisis because we are too tightly bound to Europe, with whom we trade at a deficit. The Commonwealth represents a far broader international and diverse market place with similar systems of governance and a common language and includes some of the fastest-growing economies in the world.
 Commonwealth markets have grown by 7.3 % over recent years, while the EU markets look set to contract. Yet we are limited as to how far we can exploit our ties with the Commonwealth due to EU membership. Domestic bilateral trade and investment treaties become subsumed under the new EU trade negotiations, disabling the UK from forging independent and prosperous import and export contracts with the wider world. The EU model is cumbersome and outdated. The UK must embrace globalisation as a dynamic nation with full sovereignty over policy. Isolating ourselves from the rest of the world by shackling ourselves to a failing EU project is dangerous.

Mr President, in an ever more globalised world it is vital the UK does not put all its eggs into one basket. We are disproportionately affected by the eurozone crisis because we are too tightly bound to Europe, with whom we trade at a deficit. The Commonwealth represents a far broader international and diverse market place with similar systems of governance and a common language and includes some of the fastest-growing economies in the world.
 Commonwealth markets have grown by 7.3 % over recent years, while the EU markets look set to contract. Yet we are limited as to how far we can exploit our ties with the Commonwealth due to EU membership. Domestic bilateral trade and investment treaties become subsumed under the new EU trade negotiations, disabling the UK from forging independent and prosperous import and export contracts with the wider world. The EU model is cumbersome and outdated. The UK must embrace globalisation as a dynamic nation with full sovereignty over policy. Isolating ourselves from the rest of the world by shackling ourselves to a failing EU project is dangerous.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Madam President, as a member of the Committee on International Trade, and of the Delegation for relations with Canada in the last mandate, I have been following this agreement all that time. I must say I am somewhat amazed at the alternative facts which are now in vogue in this establishment and around the world. You could say this is the age of alternative facts.
 One of them, which has been flying around my Twitter feed over the last few days, says CETA will put 90 million jobs at risk. That is nearly half the jobs in the European Union and this from a country, Canada, which has only 35 million people itself. These are the facts being perpetrated and which the people out there protesting today believe.
 If I thought it was going to cost 90 million jobs I would be against it too. In actual fact, it is the opposite. We are in favour of it because it is going to create jobs. It is going to create jobs in Europe, in Ireland, and that is what we want. The agreement with South Korea created 210 000 jobs, and yet the Canadian agreement is going to cost us jobs? Is this logical? No.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Madam President, whether it is in China, Saudi Arabia, Palestine or the incarceration of the black community in America, we should condemn human rights violations everywhere. But whenever you see Western governments and so—called liberal politicians wailing about the plight of persecuted Muslims somewhere, it’s most likely connected to geopolitical reasons.
 Where were they when millions of Muslims were being bombed out of existence in the Middle East? Where were they when Western—armed jihadists were persecuting Christians in Syria? The defence of human rights around the world as a weapon to undermine particular states is not the way forward.
 There’s no doubt about it, but the Belt and Road Initiative, which Xinjiang is crucial to, has definitely come into America’s focus. The Americans have admitted that they are pretty eager to destabilise the area, because they don’t want the Belt and Road Initiative that the Chinese have planned for so long to actually materialise.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Mr President, I too welcome what is an extremely necessary and timely initiative by the Commissioner, and I would also like to thank him very much for his cooperation and hard work during his time as Commissioner, which Parliament has appreciated very much.
 However, although I welcome the initiative, it must be said that it is very general. The Commissioner himself acknowledges that it contains a lot of very broad proposals. We want more information on thresholds for graduation and on how much the GSP will be improved for countries that are not graduated. I also look forward to more details on the rules of origin, because it is quite difficult to judge at this point whether what is being proposed is anything more than cosmetic.
 I would like to know whether the Commissioner agrees with my assessment that if the EU substantially enhances its preference system, it could meet the requirements of the improved GSP option, the EPA alternative, which some non-LDCs are continuing to call for, as the Commissioner is well aware.
 At the meeting in Gaborone, the EU agreed to postpone until 2006 the anticipated review of the situation of non-LDCs that are not in a position to enter into EPAs. It also seems to me that WTO rules allow for differentiation between developing countries in non-reciprocal trade preference schemes, provided that such arrangements are based on objective criteria and that identical treatment is available to all similarly-situated developing countries. On the basis of that analysis, I would like the Commissioner to be more specific on whether, when Cotonou was negotiated, an enhanced GSP was looked at as an option for those that could not or did not want to enter into EPA negotiations. I asked for this information in committee, but I was not entirely satisfied with the answer.
 Finally, I should like the Commissioner to provide more information and clarity on what is meant by 'vulnerable', 'special development needs' and 'small economies'. The Commissioner talked about landlocked countries, etc., but he needs to spell things out more clearly so that we know exactly what he means.

Title: [ACSS] Text labeling Manifesto
Description: Identify the most relevant labels to describe these texts
Input.text-eng:
Madam President, Madam Commissioner, dear colleagues, it is courage, determination and the eternal fight for freedom that have just scored a very big point in Hong Kong.Not only did the Chinese authorities not dared to repeat there the abomination of Place Tiananmen, but the local authorities, with the assent of Beijing, of course, canceled their decree on extradition to China.
We must applaud the demonstrators of Hong Kong and rejoice in this victory, because any decline in a government ignoring human rights benefits all the world to the freedom of all.
Our satisfaction is not sufficient, however.We must support the fight for the freedom of China which is and will remain, in any event, one of our main economic partners and one of the great powers of this century.We owe it by moral obligation, but we also owe it because we can.
We can, because in their standoff with Mr. Trump, the Chinese authorities cannot afford to alienate the Europe they need.We can, we, European parliamentarians, because our assembly is the only institution in the world which is quite strong, independent and united in its defense of human rights to be able to deal with a regime which has become the greatest,The most modern and most sophisticated dictatorships.
We can, finally, because we will soon have the possibility of manifesting it by attributing, I hope and calls you all, of all political groups, therefore by attributing the Sakharov Prize to a Chinese opponent in the person of Mr.Ilham Tohti, defender imprisoned from the Uighur people, of which he is both the child and one of the great figures.
